title: Mathematics Project-Based Learning Design Utilizing Multimodal Digital Classroom Assessment

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and experience in using digital tools
context.additional_context: Projects where medical/legal/technical experts apply multimodal digital assessments in mathematics domains

learning_goals: Learners can utilize three or more multimodal digital assessment tools to solve real-world job-related problems.

After completing project deliverables (1 data visualization report, 1 computational model) by the 3rd month of a 6-month course, learners submit self-assessments with ≥70% achievement across 5 evaluation criteria (accuracy, creativity, collaboration, practicality, completeness) and integrate peer feedback (average ≥4.0 on a 5-point scale from 3 peers per criterion) into the final evaluation report.

By comparing traditional corporate assessments (exam scores, assignment results) with multimodal digital assessment data (video analysis, quiz metrics, engagement indicators), learners conduct quantitative analyses ensuring ≥90% data consistency for 3 learning effectiveness metrics (knowledge acquisition rate, skill application, engagement change) and write a 5-page comparative report meeting ≥4 of 5 rubric criteria in APA style.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
